request.description: Registers a new user (regular, specialist, or admin). Expects email, password, and user_type. Sends OTP for email verification.
Authenticates an existing user with email/password and returns a JWT token. Requires email verification + demographics completion depending on flow.
Verifies the OTP sent to the user’s email during signup and returns a JWT token once verification succeeds.
Triggers password reset flow. Sends a fresh OTP/reset code to the specified email if it exists. Works for all user types (user, specialist, admin). The OTP code will be sent via email.

response.name: Success Response
Error - Email Not Found

request.description: Resets user password using the OTP code received via email from the forgot-password endpoint. Works for all user types (user, specialist, admin). Requires email, OTP code, and new password (minimum 8 characters).

response.name: Success Response
Error - Invalid OTP
Error - Weak Password

request.description: Allows an authenticated user to change their password. Requires both old_password and new_password for security. The new password must be at least 8 characters long. Works for all user types (user, specialist, admin). Requires JWT token in Authorization header.

header.description: JWT token from login or email-verify

response.name: Success Response
Error - Old Password Incorrect
Error - Same Password
Error - Weak Password

request.description: Stores onboarding/demographic information for a user after signup. Must be called once per user to unlock the rest of the app.

{

request.description: Preferred mobile sync endpoint. Accepts an array of daily entries (steps, calories, distance) and upserts aggregated values per day.
Creates or upserts a single day’s steps record. Useful for manual entry/edit from the client.
Returns the authenticated user’s steps entry for today (server date). 404 if no data exists.
Returns steps summary for a given YYYY-MM-DD date. Includes goal progress, calories, distance.
Paginated daily history ordered by date desc. Supports limit/page to power history screens.
Aggregates steps by ISO weeks (Sun-Sat) to power weekly charts.
Aggregates steps per calendar month for trend charts.
Updates a specific steps entry by ID (steps, calories, distance). Requires Authorization header.
Deletes a steps entry by ID. Returns success flag.
Calculates aggregated stats (totals, averages, streaks) for the last N days (default 30). Drives insights cards.
Returns the user’s current step streak and longest streak metrics.
Specialist-only endpoint. Creates profile with basic info, categories, experience, education, certifications. Must be called once after signup.
Returns the authenticated specialist’s own profile. Requires Authorization header.
Allows a specialist to update basic info, categories, education, and certifications.
Public listing endpoint used by the specialist search screen. Supports filters (verified, location, specialization, category, search, min_rating, min_experience) and pagination.
Returns top-rated specialists for quick display on the home screen. Can be limited and optionally filtered by location.
Provides auto-complete suggestions (names, specializations, categories) based on the search term typed by the user.
Fetches the public profile of a specialist by profile ID. Does not require authentication and is used for detail view before booking.
Upserts the user’s mood for today. Accepts optional journal entry and backend will store one record per day.
Use when syncing historical moods. Provide date + mood + optional journal text.
Fetches today’s mood entry for the authenticated user. 404 if not recorded.
Returns the recorded mood + journal entry for a supplied date (YYYY-MM-DD).
Paginated reverse-chronological list of moods to power the recent moods view.
Allows editing an existing mood entry by ID (change mood type or journal text).
Deletes a mood entry by ID. Useful for “remove journal” flow.
Reads specialists filtered specifically for the Spiritual Hub. Same data as specialist listing but tailored for mindfulness filters (category/location/min_rating).
Lists notifications for the authenticated user. Supports filtering by status/type and pagination.
Returns full payload for a single notification (title, body, metadata).
Marks a notification as read/unread/archived.
Marks every notification for the authenticated user as read.
Soft deletes a single notification for the user (used for swipe-to-dismiss).
Clears all notifications for the user (used for dropdown "Clear All").
Returns the unread count for the badge/dot on the UI.
Admin-only endpoint to create a reusable notification template.
Returns all notification templates (admin dashboard use).
Triggers delivery of a template to all users or a subset of user IDs.

Returns an array of all available article categories. Use this endpoint to populate category dropdowns and filters in the frontend. Categories include: Sleep, Exercise, Meditation, Mood Tracking, Fitness, Yoga. This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.

request.description:
Public endpoint. Returns array of all available forum post categories with post counts. Use this to populate the category filter dropdown in the forum screen. Categories match the article categories (22 total). Use count to show 'N posts' badge next to each category.

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": [
    {"category": "Depression", "count": 15},
    {"category": "Anxiety", "count": 23},
    {"category": "Stress Management", "count": 8},
    {"category": "Meditation", "count": 12},
    {"category": "Sleep", "count": 5}
  ]
}
```

response.name: Success 200

request.description:
Authenticated endpoint. Creates a new forum post. All users can create posts. Set is_anonymous to true if user wants to post anonymously (author will show as 'Anonymous_user_XXX'). Title must be 3-200 characters, description must be at least 10 characters. Category must be one of the valid categories from Get Categories endpoint.

**Request Body:**
- `title` (required): Post title (3-200 characters)
- `description` (required): Post description (min 10 characters)
- `category` (required): One of the valid categories from Get Categories
- `is_anonymous` (optional): Boolean, default false

**Response (201 Created):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Post created successfully",
  "data": {
    "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
    "title": "Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
    "description": "I've been struggling with social anxiety...",
    "category": "Anxiety",
    "is_anonymous": false,
    "author": "John Doe",
    "likes_count": 0,
    "comments_count": 0,
    "views": 0,
    "created_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z",
    "updated_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z"
  }
}
```

response.name: Success 201
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Post created successfully",
    "data": {
        "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
        "title": "Small Victory: I talked to someone today",
        "description": "I've been struggling with social anxiety for months, but today I managed to have a conversation with a colleague.",
        "category": "Anxiety",
        "is_anonymous": false,
        "author": "John Doe",
        "likes_count": 0,
        "comments_count": 0,
        "views": 0,
        "created_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-21T10:30:00.000Z"
    }
}

request.description:
Public endpoint. Returns paginated list of all forum posts sorted by newest first (createdAt descending). Use this for the main forum listing screen. Supports filtering by category (use exact category name from Get Categories). Optional Authorization header: if provided, response includes is_liked field for each post showing if the authenticated user liked it.

**Query Parameters:**
- `category` (optional): Filter by category name
- `page` (optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional): Page size (default: 10, max: 100)

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
      "title": "Feeling overwhelmed today",
      "description": "I've been feeling really overwhelmed...",
      "category": "Depression",
      "is_anonymous": false,
      "author": "Jane Smith",
      "likes_count": 12,
      "comments_count": 5,
      "views": 45,
      "is_liked": true,
      "created_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z",
      "updated_at": "2025-01-21T09:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 10,
    "total": 15,
    "total_pages": 2
  }
}
```

header.description: Optional: JWT token to get is_liked status for each post

query.description: Optional: Filter by category (e.g., 'Depression', 'Anxiety', 'Stress Management'). Omit to get all categories.

request.description:
Public endpoint. Searches forum posts by keyword across title and description fields. Returns paginated results sorted by newest first. Use this for the search functionality in the forum screen. If query is empty, returns all posts.

**Query Parameters:**
- `q` (required): Search query string
- `page` (optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional): Page size (default: 10, max: 100)

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
      "title": "Dealing with anxiety attacks",
      "description": "I've been experiencing anxiety attacks lately...",
      "category": "Anxiety",
      "is_anonymous": false,
      "author": "John Doe",
      "likes_count": 8,
      "comments_count": 3,
      "views": 25,

}
```

- `404 Not Found`: Post not found

request.description:
Public endpoint. Returns paginated list of top-level comments for a specific forum post with nested replies (Facebook-like structure). Top-level comments are sorted by newest first (createdAt descending), replies are sorted by oldest first (createdAt ascending). Optional Authorization header: if provided, response includes is_liked field for each comment/reply showing if the authenticated user liked it. Use this to display comments on the post detail screen. Note: Only top-level comments are counted in pagination, replies are nested within their parent comments.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional): Page size (default: 20, max: 100)

request.description:
Authenticated endpoint. Creates a new comment on a forum post or a reply to an existing comment (Facebook-like functionality). Content must be 1-1000 characters. Set is_anonymous to true if user wants to comment anonymously (author will show as 'Anonymous_user_XXX'). To create a reply, include parent_comment_id with the ID of the comment you're replying to. Note: You can only reply to top-level comments (not replies to replies - only one level of nesting is allowed). When a user comments on another user's post, a notification is automatically sent to the post author. When a user replies to a comment, a notification is sent to the comment author. Comment count on the post is automatically incremented only for top-level comments (replies don't increment the post's comment count).

**Request Body:**
- `content` (required): Comment content (1-1000 characters)
- `is_anonymous` (optional): Boolean, default false
- `parent_comment_id` (optional): Comment ID to reply to (null for top-level comment)

**Response (201 Created - Top-Level Comment):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Comment added successfully",
  "data": {
    "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
    "post_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
    "parent_comment_id": null,
    "content": "This is a helpful comment on the post.",
    "is_anonymous": false,
    "author": "John Doe",
    "likes_count": 0,
    "is_liked": false,
    "created_at": "2025-01-21T11:30:00.000Z",
    "updated_at": "2025-01-21T11:30:00.000Z",
    "replies": []
  }
}
```

**Response (201 Created - Reply):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Comment added successfully",
  "data": {
    "_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012349",
    "post_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345",
    "parent_comment_id": "65a1b2c3d4e5f6789012346",
    "content": "I completely agree with your point!",
    "is_anonymous": false,
    "author": "Jane Smith",
    "likes_count": 0,
    "is_liked": false,
    "created_at": "2025-01-21T11:45:00.000Z",
    "updated_at": "2025-01-21T11:45:00.000Z",
    "replies": []
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `400 Bad Request`: Cannot reply to a reply, invalid parent comment ID, or validation error
- `404 Not Found": Parent comment not found

request.description:
**Authenticated endpoint.** Returns comprehensive progress data for the Wellness Tracking Progress tab. This endpoint provides:

- **Today's Steps**: Current step count for today
- **Day Streak**: Consecutive days with step activity (calculated from steps entries)
- **Streak Status**: Visual indicator - `on_fire` (7+ days), `active` (3-6 days), `inactive` (<3 days)
- **Weekly Goal**: Auto-created weekly goal tracking (default: 6000 steps per week, Monday-Sunday)
- **This Week Activity**: Daily breakdown for the current week (Monday to Sunday)

**Weekly Goal Auto-Creation:**
- Weekly goals are automatically created when first accessed
- Each week starts on Monday at 00:00:00
- Goals reset weekly and track steps from Monday to Sunday
- Current steps are calculated from all step entries within the week

**Response Fields:**
- `today_steps` (number): Steps recorded today
- `day_streak` (number): Consecutive days with step activity
- `streak_status` (string): `on_fire` | `active` | `inactive`
- `weekly_goal.target` (number): Target steps for the week (default: 6000)
- `weekly_goal.current` (number): Current steps this week
- `weekly_goal.percentage` (number): Progress percentage (0-100)
- `this_week_activity` (array): 7-day array with `day` (Mo-Su), `date` (YYYY-MM-DD), `steps` (number)

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "today_steps": 3456,
    "day_streak": 7,
    "streak_status": "on_fire",
    "weekly_goal": {
      "target": 6000,
      "current": 3045,
      "percentage": 50.75
    },
    "this_week_activity": [
      {"day": "Mo", "date": "2025-01-20", "steps": 2345},
      {"day": "Tu", "date": "2025-01-21", "steps": 2345}
    ]
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `401 Unauthorized`: Missing or invalid authentication token

response.name: Success 200

request.description:
**Authenticated endpoint.** Returns comprehensive plant growth data for the Wellness Tracking Pet Growth tab. This endpoint provides:

**XP System:**
- XP is **only** calculated from **CLAIMED** achievements (not just unlocked)
- Users must unlock an achievement (meet requirements) AND claim it to receive XP
- Total XP determines the plant level

**Plant Levels (6 Total):**
1. **Seed** (0 XP) - Starting your journey
2. **Sprout** (100 XP) - Developing well
3. **Seedling** (1000 XP) - Growing strong
4. **Budding Plant** (3000 XP) - Blossoming beautifully
5. **Flowering Plant** (5000 XP) - Blooming beautifully
6. **Mature Plant** (10000 XP) - Strong and resilient

**Response Fields:**
- `current_level` (number): Current plant level (1-6)
- `level_name` (string): Name of current level
- `current_xp` (number): Total XP earned from claimed achievements
- `xp_for_next_level` (number): XP threshold for next level
- `xp_needed` (number): XP remaining to reach next level
- `total_xp_earned` (number): Same as current_xp (total from claimed achievements)
- `can_level_up` (boolean): Whether user has enough XP to level up
- `levels` (array): All 6 levels with:
  - `level` (number): Level number (1-6)
  - `name` (string): Level name
  - `xp_required` (number): XP threshold for this level
  - `status` (string): `unlocked` | `current` | `locked`
  - `description` (string): Level description
  - `can_unlock` (boolean): Whether user can unlock this level
  - `xp_needed` (number): XP needed to unlock (if locked)
  - `progress` (object): Progress bar information:
    - `current_xp` (number): Current XP towards this level
    - `total_xp` (number): Total XP required for this level
    - `percentage` (number): Progress percentage (0-100)
    - `xp_needed` (number): XP remaining

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "current_level": 2,
    "level_name": "Sprout",
    "current_xp": 130,
    "xp_for_next_level": 1000,

          "total_xp": 0,
          "percentage": 100,
          "xp_needed": 0
        }
      },
      {
        "level": 2,
        "name": "Sprout",
        "xp_required": 100,
        "status": "current",
        "description": "Developing well",
        "can_unlock": false,
        "xp_needed": 0,
        "progress": {
          "current_xp": 130,
          "total_xp": 100,
          "percentage": 100,
          "xp_needed": 0
        }
      },
      {
        "level": 3,
        "name": "Seedling",
        "xp_required": 1000,
        "status": "locked",
        "description": "Growing strong",
        "can_unlock": false,
        "xp_needed": 870,
        "progress": {
          "current_xp": 130,
          "total_xp": 1000,
          "percentage": 13,
          "xp_needed": 870
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `401 Unauthorized`: Missing or invalid authentication token

request.description:
**Authenticated endpoint.** Returns rewards data for the Wellness Tracking Rewards tab. Shows all unlocked and claimed achievements with their claimable status.

**Achievement Status Flow:**
1. **LOCKED**  Achievement not started or in progress
2. **IN_PROGRESS**  User is working towards the achievement (progress < 100%)
3. **UNLOCKED**  Achievement requirements met (automatic) - User can now claim
4. **CLAIMED**  User manually claimed the achievement - XP awarded

**Important:**
- **Unlock** = Automatic when requirements are met (e.g., 7 days streak)
- **Claim** = Manual action by user to collect XP reward
- **XP is only awarded when achievement is CLAIMED**, not just unlocked
- Use `is_claimable: true` to show "Claim" button in UI
- After claiming, use `POST /api/v1/achievements/:id/claim` endpoint

**Response Fields:**
- `rewards` (array): All unlocked/claimed achievements, sorted by most recent
  - `id` (string): Achievement ID (use for claiming)
  - `name` (string): Achievement name
  - `description` (string): Achievement description
  - `icon` (string): Achievement icon/emoji
  - `status` (string): `unlocked` | `claimed`
  - `is_claimable` (boolean): `true` if status is `unlocked` (can be claimed)
  - `xp_reward` (number): XP awarded when claimed
  - `unlocked_at` (string): ISO timestamp when unlocked
  - `claimed_at` (string): ISO timestamp when claimed (only if status is `claimed`)

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "rewards": [
      {
        "id": "achievement_id",
        "name": "Week Warrior",
        "description": "7 days in a row",
        "icon": "",
        "status": "unlocked",
        "is_claimable": true,
        "xp_reward": 100,
        "unlocked_at": "2025-01-20T10:00:00Z"
      },
      {
        "id": "achievement_id_2",
        "name": "Community Helper",
        "description": "helped 5 people in forums",
        "icon": "",
        "status": "claimed",
        "is_claimable": false,
        "xp_reward": 50,
        "unlocked_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00Z",
        "claimed_at": "2025-01-15T10:05:00Z"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `401 Unauthorized`: Missing or invalid authentication token

response.name: Success 200

- Mark achievement as claimed after viewing

**Requirements:**
- Achievement must be in `unlocked` status
- Achievement must belong to the authenticated user
- Achievement must exist in the database

**Response (200 OK):**

```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Achievement claimed successfully",
  "achievement": {
    "id": "673a1b2c3d4e5f6a7b8c9d0e",

    "description": "7 days in a row",
    "icon": "star",
    "xp_reward": 100
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `404 Not Found`: Achievement is not unlocked yet or achievement not found for this user

request.description:
Fetches all active audio files from the database with their metadata. This endpoint returns a paginated list of audio files that can be played in the app. Each audio includes essential information: ID, name (title), duration in seconds, and stream URL.

**Use Cases:**
- Display audio library in app
- Show available meditation/breathing exercises
- Filter and search audio files
- Paginate through large audio collections

**Query Parameters:**
- `language` (optional): Filter by language (Urdu, English)
- `category` (optional): Filter by category (Breathing, Meditation, Sleep, etc.)
- `search` (optional): Search by audio name or description
- `page` (optional): Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional): Number of results per page (default: 20, max: 50)

**Response Fields:**
- `success` (boolean): Request success status
- `data` (array): Array of audio objects
  - `id` (string): Unique audio ID (MongoDB ObjectId)
  - `name` (string): Audio title/name
  - `duration` (number): Duration in seconds
  - `stream_url` (string): URL path to stream the audio file
- `pagination` (object): Pagination metadata
  - `page` (number): Current page number
  - `limit` (number): Results per page
  - `total` (number): Total number of audios
  - `total_pages` (number): Total number of pages
  - `has_next` (boolean): Whether there's a next page
  - `has_prev` (boolean): Whether there's a previous page

**Response (200 OK):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "67890abc123def456",
      "name": "Sukoon Bhari Saans",
      "duration": 300,

    "limit": 20,
    "total": 14,
    "total_pages": 1,
    "has_next": false,
    "has_prev": false
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**

request.description:
Streams the complete audio file. This endpoint sends the entire audio file in a single HTTP response (200 OK). The file is sent as `audio/mpeg` content type and can be played directly in HTML5 audio players, mobile apps, or any media player that supports HTTP audio streaming.

**How It Works:**
- Sends complete file in single response (no Range Request support)
- Suitable for small files (~2MB)
- Returns 200 OK with full file content
- Content-Type: `audio/mpeg`
- Includes Content-Length header
- Cached for 1 year (Cache-Control)

**Use Cases:**
- Play audio in web browsers (HTML5 audio)
- Play audio in mobile apps (Flutter, React Native)
- Download audio files
- Stream to media players

**Path Parameters:**
- `filename` (required): Audio filename (must match filename in database)
  - Example: `Audio1_Sukoon_Bhari_Saans_Urdu.mp3`
  - URL encoding is handled automatically

**Response Headers:**
- `Content-Type`: `audio/mpeg`
- `Content-Length`: File size in bytes
- `Cache-Control`: `public, max-age=31536000` (1 year)

**Response (200 OK):**
- Binary audio file content (MP3)
- Can be played directly in audio players

**Error Responses:**
- `400 Bad Request`: Invalid filename (path traversal attempt)
- `404 Not Found`: Audio file not found on server
- `500 Internal Server Error`: Server error reading file

**Example Usage:**
```html
<audio controls>
  <source src="http://localhost:5002/api/v1/audio/stream/Audio1_Sukoon_Bhari_Saans_Urdu.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
</audio>
```

**Flutter Example:**
```dart
final audioPlayer = AudioPlayer();
await audioPlayer.play(UrlSource('http://localhost:5002/api/v1/audio/stream/Audio1_Sukoon_Bhari_Saans_Urdu.mp3'));
```
